Deprecated expectation functions

Source: R/deprec-expect.R
expect-deprec.Rd

These functions are deprecated.

See Generic Expectation Functions and Cross-dataset Expectations for current expectation functions.

expect_func(var, ...)

expect_join(data2, by = NULL, not = FALSE, flt = TRUE, data = get_testdata())

expect_similar(
  var,
  data2,
  var2,
  flt = TRUE,
  flt2 = flt,
  threshold = 0.05,
  min = 100,
  data = get_testdata()
)

Arguments

var

an unquoted variable name
...

arguments to pass to expect_allany()
data2

the dataset to compare against
by

a character vector of variables to join by. For details see dplyr join().
not

reverse the results of the check
flt

a filter specifying a subset of the dataset to test
data

data frame to test. The global test data is used by default.
var2

an unquoted variable name from data2
flt2

a filter specifying a subset of data2 to test
threshold

the maximum proportional difference allowed between the two categories
min

the minimum number of responses for a category to allow comparison. This avoidmall categories raising spurious errors

See also

Generic Expectation Functions

Cross-dataset Expectations
